hours_text:
## Visit Us:

##### Location

##### Manatee County Agricultural Museum

1015 6th St. West Palmetto, FL 34221

###### Hours

Tuesday - Friday and

1st & 3rd Saturday of the month 

10 AM - 4 PM

###### Contact Information

Email: 

[agriculturalmuseum@manateeclerk.com](mailto:agriculturalmuseum@manateeclerk.com)

Phone: 941-721-2034

## Upcoming 2026 Closures & Special Hours:

None.

## Find Us on Google Maps:

## Take a Virtual Tour!

###### Admission 

Museum admission is free, but donations are appreciated. ​

Suggested donation:

$3 per adult 

$1 per student

[](https://www.loom.com/share/e0108730a0e2418da61853c4e5fb711e?sid=7e269996-e54e-44b5-a2e3-e3e30c4b3c35)

###### Parking

Parking is free and can be found in front of the Palmetto Historical Park on 10th Ave. West and in the city lot behind the Palmetto Public Library on 6th St. Free city parking is available surrounding Palmetto Historical Park and the Ag Museum on a first-come first-served basis.

###### Accessibility

The museum is step-free and fully wheelchair accessible. The Ag Museum's outdoor sensory garden has a wooden ramp and is accessible from the museum's entrance via paved sidewalks.

​

Changing tables are available in each of the men's and women's accessible restrooms. 

​

If you have any questions regarding accessibility, please contact us by calling 941-721-2034 or via email at [agriculturalmuseum@manateeclerk.com](mailto:agriculturalmuseum@manateeclerk.com?subject=Accessibility%20Inquiry).

admission_text:
## Why become a member?

Becoming a member of the Ag Museum or renewing your current membership is one of the most important ways you can show your recurring support. Memberships provide much needed funds to continue and improve the many programs the museum provides. From the family programs the museum organizes to the annual Halloween, Christmas, and Heritage Festival events put on in collaboration with the Palmetto Historical Park, your support helps make all of that possible!

## What does a membership include?

## 

All Memberships Include: “Here’s the DIRT” museum e-newsletter; “Bringing You The Buzz” membership magazine; invitations to exhibition receptions & members only events; discount registration on workshops and classes.

​

Some membership levels include [NARM ](https://narmassociation.org/)benefits. The North American Reciprocal Museum Association is one of the largest reciprocal membership programs in the world! NARM has over 1,100 arts, cultural, and historical institutions along with botanical gardens, children’s museums, science and technology centers and more that offer their individual NARM qualified members reciprocal benefits. Present your valid membership card to any participating NARM institution to receive:

​​

  * Free/member admission during regular museum hours

  * Member discounts at museum shops

  * Discounts on concert/lecture tickets

Guests are not included unless they present a current membership card validated with the accepted NARM ident...
